bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lucilla Schumann, January 5, 1953

div1.p: Hench appreciates the flowers Schumann prepared and the kindness she showed him while he was in Cuba. He will send her several documents concerning Camp Lazear and the Nobel Festival.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Lucilla Schumann, January 5, 1953
div1.opener:
January 5, 1953
Senorita Lucilla Schumann
Milagros Flores
Prado 202
Habana, Cuba
My dear Senorita Schumann:
div1.p:
Slowly recovering from the Christmas festivities into which I plunged on
my return from Havana, I am now able to write to my Cuban friends who were
so kind to me on my recent visit to Havana. Among them was your good self.
I shall never forget your very real kindness to me and to the institutions
which I represented. The flowers which you prepared for us were so magnificent
and I know very well that you must have given them to me and to the institu-
tions at a very special rate.

It was so thoughtful of you to spend the noon hour with Mr. Caswell and me
translating my remarks into Spanish and then going to the special trouble
of having such nice cards printed. I am very grateful also for the extra
set of cards which you gave me. The day after the ceremony I went back to
Campamento Lazear and took with my own camera photographs of all the flowers
in place. I am now sending copies of these photographs to the institutions
and organizations which presented the flowers. I know that they will be as
grateful to you as I am for your outstanding courtesy.

My wife was simply delighted with the candles and candle holders. They were
so lovely and festive. At first I had planned to put them under the tree
for her to open Christmas morning as a Christmas present from you but then I
decided that they were too lovely to save and that they should be opened be-
fore Christmas and used to decorate our parlor. Mrs. Hench thought them very
beautiful. They have attracted the admiring compliments of friends who have
called. They are placed in our parlor on either side of a large mirror
and look very nice indeed.

Because of your interest in the Camp Lazear dedication, permit me to send you
a little article which will explain exactly what happened there. I hope you
will be interested and amused in the description of how Mr. Moran, Mr. Pogolotti
and I rediscovered the Camp in 1940 (see pages 3 to 7). I hope you can visit
the camp some day. Mr. Caswell and I looked for you the morning of the dedica-
tion and we had a seat reserved especially for you. I was sorry that you could
not be there.

Because of your interest in cortisone as a result of your mother's use of it,
permit me to send you also a reprint of the Nobel Festival for 1950, and it has
been my pleasure to autograph it for you. I hope indeed that on my next trip
to Havana Mrs. Hench will be with me as she and you would get along famously
Senorita Lucilla Schumann
- 2 -
January 5, 1953
together. I think you both have the same outlook on life and we will
certainly call and pay our respects.
Again, with my very sincere appreciation and thanks,
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, P. S. Hench, M.D. PSH:alc
